summary: This bill, the Worker Relief and Credit Reform Act of 2025, primarily focuses on expanding and improving the earned income tax credit (EITC).  Key provisions include extending the EITC to qualifying students, modifying age requirements, and treating caregiving and learning as compensated work.  It also changes the percentages and amounts associated with the credit, introduces advance monthly payments of the EITC, mandates an outreach program to educate taxpayers about the credit, and outlines implementation details, with amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
